Articles.Content:
When I open KSP, it loads for a few seconds and then stops, at AirplanePlus/parts/@thumbs/herculesprop_icon (As you can tell, I have AirplanePlus installed, as well as Tweakscale, KAS, Kerbal Foundries, Grounded Modular Vehicles, KSO Space center vehicles, Modular Launchpads, Firespitter, and Module Manager)

I went into GameData, following the path showed in the loading sscreen, and saw that the file mentioned (herculesprop_icon) was 0 bytes and the thumnail was only an image placeholder icon, while the other files showed what they were (Screenshot below)

What do I do? I don't want to redownload AirplanePlus because it was 100 MB and I have slow internet, and I only need that one file. Would it work if someone else who had AirplanePlus put that file in Dropbox or something similar so I could use it to replace the apparently corrupted file? What do I do?

I had been using AirplanePlus for a few days without any problems (until now, obviously)
Do you have part files in this directory  \GameData\AirplanePlus\Parts\Engine\Modern\hercules ?
There is a herculesblur, herculesproptex, model.mu, and part.cfg in the folder, so yes.

31 minutes ago, Ben J. Kerman said:

so yes

delete the 0 byte file. @thumbs create themselves during load. (There is no @thumbs directory in the mod ZIP from CKAN). Then start your game again and see what happens.  If it fails post your ksp.log and your player.log

It worked! 

Thank you so much @Caerfinon!

7 minutes ago, Ben J. Kerman said:

It worked! 

any time
